alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 10:34AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Including the following area for Tanana River in Manley Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 AM AKDT, An ice jam has formed on the Tanana River downstream from Manley Hot Springs. River observer in Manley Hot Springs reported significant flooding in Manley Hot Springs as water continues to rise along with ice flowing up through the slough. The observer reported that almost all roads in Manley are flooded and that several houses on the slough bank have water either in or surrounding them. Water is over the Elliott Highway across from the Manley Hot Springs bathhouse. Water level as of 930 am AKDT were estimated 1 foot below the lowest girder on the bridge over the Manley slough. - This is a major flooding event for Manley Hot Springs, this is the highest water level the river observer in 45 years and is approaching the record flood of 1956. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
